abstract: Child custody battle between former partners Circe Hamilton and Kelly Gunn is testing New York State's expanded definition of parenthood; definition, designed to account for complexity of nontraditional families, allows judges to consider couple's intent to have and raise child together; case concerns Gunn's right to be recognized as parent to 6-year-old boy adopted by Hamilton from Ethiopia in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A judge must decide whether a woman’s intentions and involvement with the child adopted by her former partner are enough to formally recognize her as a parent.
snippet: A judge must decide whether a woman’s intentions and involvement with the child adopted by her former partner are enough to formally recognize her as a parent....

headline.main: A Complex Case Tests New York State’s Expanded Definition of Parenthood
headline.print_headline: A Complicated Case Tests the State’s Expanded Definition of Parenthood
